2 ^ Domine exaudī ōrātiōnem meam: 3 ^ Nōn āvertās faciem tuam ā mē. In quācumque diē trībulor
et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: inclīnā ad mē aurem tuam; in quācumque diē invocāverō tē
O Lord: vēlōciter exaudī mē. ^ Turn not away thy face from me. In the day when I am in trouble
my prayer: incline thy ear to me; in what day soever I shall call upon thee

2 ^ Domine exaudī ōrātiōnem meam: 4 ^ Quia dēfēcērunt sīcut fūmus diēs meī
et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: et ossa mea sīcut cremium āruērunt. ^ For my days are vanished like smoke
O Lord: and my bones are grown dry like fuel for the fire.

et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: et āruit cor meum
O Lord: quia oblītus sum comedere pānem meum. ^ I am smitten as grass
S because I forgot to eat my bread.

2 ^ Domine exaudī ōrātiōnem meam: 6 ^ Ā vōce gemitūs meī adhaesit os meum carnī meae. ^ Through the voice of my groaning
et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: my bone hath cleaved to my flesh.

2 ^ Domine exaudī ōrātiōnem meam: 7 ^ Similis factus sum pelicānō sōlitūdinis; factus sum sīcut nicticorax in domiciliō. ^ I am become like to a pelican of the wilderness; I am like a night raven in the house.

et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: et factus sum sīcut passer sōlitārius in tectō. ^ I have watched
O Lord: and am become as a sparrow all alone on the housetop.

2 ^ Domine exaudī ōrātiōnem meam: 9 ^ Tōtā diē exprobrābant mihi inimīcī meī
et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: et quī laudābant mē adversum mē jūrābant; ^ All the day long my enemies reproached me
O Lord: and they that praised me did swear against me.

et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: et pōtum meum cum flētū miscēbam
O Lord: ^ For I did eat ashes like bread
my prayer: and mingled my drink with weeping

2 ^ Domine exaudī ōrātiōnem meam: 11 ^ a faciē īrae et indignātiōnis tuae; quia ēlevans allīsistī mē. ^ because of thy anger and indignation; for having lifted me up thou hast thrown me down.

et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: et egō sīcut foenum aruī. ^ My days have declined like a shadow
O Lord: and I am withered like grass.

et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: Domine
my prayer: et memoriāle tuum in generātiōnem et generātiōnem. ^ But thou
column7: and thy memorial to all generations.

et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: quia tempus miserendī ejus
O Lord: quia venit tempus. ^ Thou shalt arise and have mercy on Sion
my prayer: for it is time to have mercy on it

2 ^ Domine exaudī ōrātiōnem meam: 15 ^ Quoniam placuērunt servīs tuīs lapidēs ejus
et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: et terrae ejus miserēbuntur. ^ For the stones thereof have pleased thy servants
O Lord: and they shall have pity on the earth thereof.

et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: Domine
O Lord: et omnēs rēgēs terrae glōriam tuam. ^ All the Gentiles shall fear thy name
and all the kings of the earth thy glory.

et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: et vidēbitur in glōriā suā. ^ For the Lord hath built up Sion
O Lord: and he shall be seen in his glory.

2 ^ Domine exaudī ōrātiōnem meam: 18 ^ Respexit in ōrātiōnem humilium et nōn sprēvit precem eōrum. ^ He hath had regard to the prayer of the humble
et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: and he hath not despised their petition.
et populus
my prayer: laudābit Dominum. ^ Let these things be written unto another generation
and the people that shall be created shall praise the Lord

2 ^ Domine exaudī ōrātiōnem meam: 20 ^ Quia prōspexit dē excelsō sanctō suō; Dominus dē caelō in terram aspexit
et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: ^ because he hath looked forth from his high sanctuary; from heaven the Lord hath looked upon the earth

2 ^ Domine exaudī ōrātiōnem meam: 21 ^ ut audīret gemitūs compedītōrum; ut solveret fīliōs interemptōrum; ^ that he might hear the groans of them that are in fetters; that he might release the children of the slain;
22 ^ ut adnuntiet in Sion nōmen Dominī
et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: et laudem ejus in Jerusalem. ^ that they may declare the name of the Lord in Sion
et rēgēs ut serviant Dominō. ^ When the people assemble together

2 ^ Domine exaudī ōrātiōnem meam: 24 ^ Respondit eī in viā virtūtis suae: Paucitātem diērum meōrum nuntiā mihi. ^ He answered him in the way of his strength: Declare unto me the fewness of my days.
25 ^ Nē revocēs mē in dīmidiō diērum meōrum
et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: in generātiōnem et generātiōnem annī tuī. ^ Call me not away in the midst of my days; thy years are unto generation and generation.
Domine
my prayer: et opera manuum tuārum sunt caelī. ^ In the beginning
column7: and the heavens are the works of thy hands.

et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: tū autem permanēs
et mūtābuntur; ^ They shall perish but thou remainest
column6: and all of them shall grow old like a garment
column7: and as a vesture thou shalt change them

et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: et annī tuī nōn dēficient. ^ But thou art always the selfsame
O Lord: and thy years shall not fail.

et clāmor meus ad tē veniat. ^ Hear: et sēmen eōrum in saeculum dīrigētur. ^ The children of thy servants shall continue and their seed shall be directed for ever.
